page.title: 18Margam Park The Fallow Deer
page.content: Margam Park has a fine herd of approx- imately 400 Fallow deer that are prob- ably descendants of a small herd introduced in the C16th. Present are common and black Fallow and a small number of white deer. Each winter about one hundred are culled to main- tain the herd at the present figure and avoid overgrazing. Recently red deer have been reintroduced after a century's absence. Deer from the estate have escaped into Margam Forest where they are widely distributed. Poaching is an habitual problem. In October 1985, a red deer stag supposed to have escaped from Margam Park caused a pile up on the M4 motor- way. The stag was in collision with a Ford Escort car, a bus and Rolls Royce before it was killed. All three vehicles were damaged in the crash.
